current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to crack down on fraud in the Medicare program to
			 protect seniors, people with disabilities, and taxpayers.

text.#text: The amendments made by this section shall be effective as of October 1, 2015.

A non-governmental entity participating in the Partnership (including a private insurer) that—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that does not
			 include individually identifiable information with respect to any health

			 supplier, or other person or organization as having committed fraud or
			 having committed acts suspected of being fraudulent.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Stop Schemes and Crimes Against Medicare and Seniors (Stop SCAMS) Act/s:4/ss:b/p:1/sp:B/cl:ii

text.#text: The data described in this clause is aggregated claims data or other information described in

is the subject of a bona fide fraud investigation conducted by the entity
			 participating in the
			 Partnership, including a private insurer, that is providing the
			 information;

is the subject of a fraud-related allegation that has been filed by or received by the entity
			 participating in the Partnership, including a private
			 insurer, that is providing the information; or
has been convicted of a fraud-related offense.

The information described in this clause is information concerning fraud or suspected fraudulent
			 acts that identifies a specific health care provider, supplier, or other
			 person or organization if the provider, supplier, or other person or
			 organization
			 so identified—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Stop Schemes and Crimes Against Medicare and Seniors (Stop SCAMS) Act/s:4/ss:b/p:1

text.#text: The immunity described in
the data or information involved was provided in good faith and without malice; and

the data or information provided is true, based on a reasonable belief, to the	 knowledge of the
			 person providing the information, or if false, the
			 information is provided without knowledge of, and without reckless
			 disregard for, its falsity.

For purposes of this subsection, data or information relating to a specific provider or supplier
			 received by a private insurer solely through the Partnership shall be
			 used, with respect to such provider or supplier, only for the purpose of
			 informing decisionmaking by the private insurer related to fraud
			 investigations, including whether to conduct such an investigation.
			 Nothing in the preceding sentence shall prevent a private insurer or other
			 entity participating in the Partnership from taking other
			 actions, not specific to such
			 provider or supplier, based on such data or information.
